page.title: 08SCHOOLDAYS YESTERDAY & TODAY
page.content: Nonington Church of England Primary School is a small village school. The building dates from 1861 and consisted of a hall and two classrooms. The toilets used to be outside and they often froze in the winter. One hundred years ago there were over one hundred children at the school. The children were often kept away from school to go crow scaring, pick crops or go stone gathering. The punishments used to be very severe, for instance in the punishment book we read that a girl was given three strokes of the cane for making an impudent gesture.
